items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Higher than normal tides over the next three days may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from today, Wednesday 22 October, and for the next three days. 
We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  The Broads and river levels will remain high over the next couple of days due to tide locking from the current spring tides and surge from a low pressure system. 
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities . 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Tamar, River Strat, River Neet, River Ottery, River Kensey

items.message:
Forecast high river levels tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 23 October 2025 from the early hours and into Thursday morning. 
Heavy rain is forecast overnight and into Thursday morning. Forecast levels may cause flooding to low lying land and roads close to rivers from around 3am on Thursday. We expect the rivers to remain high throughout Thursday though no flooding to properties is currently forecast. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Coast from Heacham to north of King's Lynn in Norfolk
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 6:15am to 10:15am on 23.10.2025 
Areas most at risk are Heacham, Snettisham, Ingoldisthorpe, Dersingham and Wolferton. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  King's Lynn of 4.51mAODN at 8:15am on Thursday 23, which is 0.91m above tide tables, wind Force 8, Northerly. The high tide tomorrow afternoon is expected to be as high. 
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities . 
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides and forecast weather conditions tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 6:15am to 10:15am on 23.10.2025 
Areas most at risk are around Hunstanton seafront.  Flood gates in the area will be closed by the Local Authority which will make access difficult. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  King's Lynn of 4.51mAODN at 8:15am on Thursday 23, which is 0.91m above tide tables, wind Force 8, Northerly. The high tide tomorrow afternoon is expected to be as high. 
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities . 
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 23 October 2025 or as the situation changes.
